vulnerabilities.longMessage: The eval function is extremely dangerous. Because if any user input is not handled correctly and passed to it, it will be possible to execute code remotely in the context of your application (RCE - Remote Code Executuion).

vulnerabilities.shortMessage: It is always recommended to use some CHF (Cryptographic Hash Function), which is mathematically strong and not reversible. SHA512 would be the most recommended hash for storing the password and it is also important to adopt some type of Salt, so that the Hash is more secure.

vulnerabilities.shortMessage: It is always recommended to use some CHF (Cryptographic Hash Function), which is mathematically strong and not reversible.
